授業方法:
*The format and schedule may change during the semester, depending on student needs and the evolving coronavirus situation.

This seminar style class will be conducted online (‘on-demand’ via Edmodo and ‘real time’ via Zoom.) Assignments will be conducted, and lesson resources provided, on Edmodo. As such, students will need access to a computer at home. Please access the Zoom link provided on Luna and Edmodo. Look out for a message from me on Luna.

Short lectures will be given by the instructor each week. Students are expected to take notes, as these lectures will introduce the themes of the course. Supplementary readings will be assigned for homework to introduce additional information and deepen students’ understanding. Students will also do further research on these topics.

Students will have to regularly demonstrate detailed and critical understanding of the content of these lectures and readings, as they will form the basis of written assignments, and active pair and group discussions, presentations, and debates in spoken English in the following class.

トピック.授業外学習2:
Outside of class:
- Most weeks you will read and analyse articles. These support short lectures delivered in class, and form the basis for in-class written responses and discussions. This should take approximately 1 hour a week.
- In addition, please review each lesson, and check any new content, language or skills learned. This should take approximately 30 minutes a week.
- Written responses and active participation in class discussions are a big part of the grade for this course. Insufficient preparation outside class will severely affect your grade.
- Access any online material required. Some assignments may involve doing additional online research.
- Do not hesitate to contact me if you need any help, I'm happy to speak to you ( stringer@kwansei.ac.jp )
